alert.note: Alert for Caroline; City of Richmond; Goochland; Hanover; Henrico; King William; King and Queen; Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 6:02PM EDT until June 17 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LOUISA...NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN...CENTRAL GOOCHLAND...NORTHWESTERN HENRICO...CAROLINE...HANOVER AND NORTHWESTERN KING WILLIAM COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 602 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Loretto to near Hanover to 6 miles east of Gum Spring, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Hanover, Mangohick and Dawn around 605 PM EDT. Studley around 610 PM EDT. Wyndham and Aylett around 615 PM EDT. Tuckahoe around 620 PM EDT. Randolph Macon College, Laurel and Glen Allen around 625 PM EDT. Richmond and Lakeside around 630 PM EDT. Mechanicsville and East Highland Park around 635 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Chilesburg, Orchid, Gum Tree, Etna Mills, Chamberlayne, Atlee, Ashcake, Nancy Wrights Corner, Ruther Glen and Duane Fork. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
